responsibilities: Collaborate with product management, technical & partner marketing, and sales to develop product positioning and articulate key messaging.
Collaborate with technical and corporate marketing as a product expert to support NI’s go-to-market campaigns and bring new products to market.
Create white papers, presentations, videos, product demonstrations, and other web collateral to position and generate demand for NI’s products and technology.
Manage product launches and coordinate with cross-functional teams for successful rollouts.
Develop a strong understanding of the target buyer persona(s) for NI’s products, including their needs, challenges, and decision drivers.
Develop expertise in applications for which CompactDAQ and CompactRIO address key customer challenges.
Support pre-sales activities as an NI product expert.
Support product-centric sales training activities across direct and indirect channels.
Gather and analyze customer feedback to improve product messaging and positioning.
Monitor product and campaign performance metrics to assess marketing effectiveness.
Represent the company at industry events, trade shows, and conferences.
qualifications: Strong communication skills: Proficiency in technical writing, engaging/educational video content, and presenting to diverse audiences.
Project leadership: A proven ability to drive tasks and projects to successful completion.
Collaboration: The ability to effectively interact with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Problem-solving: Skill in diagnosing technical issues and offering creative, practical solutions.
Adaptability and self-motivation: A desire to learn quickly, thrive in ambiguity, and take initiative.
analysis: The job responsibilities and skills listed do not explicitly mention Generative AI (GenAI) or language models (LLMs). The responsibilities focus on product positioning, marketing, sales support, and customer engagement for NI’s products, specifically CompactDAQ and CompactRIO. The skills required include communication, project leadership, collaboration, problem-solving, and adaptability. These are general skills applicable to many roles in product marketing and management. There is no indication that the role involves developing, using, or working with GenAI or LLMs. The focus is more on traditional marketing and product management activities rather than on AI technologies.
